alert.note: Alert for Polk (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 1:47PM CDT until May 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Dade, Lawrence, McDonald, Newton and Polk. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Sons Creek at County Road 113, Center Creek at Azalea Drive, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road and Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Joplin, Neosho, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Greenfield, Pineville and Galena. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
